basics.name: Carlos Guerrero
basics.label: Full Stack & DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: Fell in love with programming at first sight—since then, it has been an endless journey of building, breaking, and learning.

work.name: Anaconda
work.summary: Architected and implemented a comprehensive serverless infrastructure for deploying and managing AI agents and LLMs on AWS Lambda, creating an efficient, scalable solution for AI workloads with OpenAI-compatible interfaces.
highlights: Designed a serverless architecture that reduced operational costs and improved improving scalability for AI agent deployment
Implemented CI/CD pipelines that decreased deployment time to minutes
Developed a RESTful API layer for seamless agent management and orchestration
Engineered a queue-based communication system enabling complex multi-agent workflows
responsibilities: Engineered a robust serverless infrastructure optimized for AI agent and LLM execution within AWS Lambda constraints
Created an automated deployment workflow enabling rapid prototyping and iteration of AI agents without infrastructure management overhead
Implemented a message queue system for asynchronous and fault-tolerant inter-agent communication using OpenAI-compatible interfaces
achievements: Successfully deployed a Slack-integrated Agent that connected to Jupyter and was able to help Scientists improve their notebooks and even execute Python code from Slack
Created a standardized OpenAI-compatible communication protocol enabling plug-and-play integration of new agent components
Implemented traceability and monitoring for all components, enabling real-time performance analysis and debugging using AWS X-Ray and CloudWatch

work.name: Masterworks
work.summary: Initially hired as a Backend Engineer, rapidly transitioned to DevOps leadership role to transform the company's infrastructure. Led comprehensive migrations from third-party solutions to self-managed AWS infrastructure, dramatically improving developer experience and deployment reliability.
highlights: Migrated frontend hosting from Netlify to self-managed AWS CloudFront infrastructure, enabling advanced A/B testing capabilities and granular performance optimizations
Transformed backend deployment from Jenkins/Kubernetes to GitHub Actions/AWS Fargate, reducing infrastructure costs by 35% and deployment failures by 80%
Implemented per-branch environment provisioning that eliminated cross-team merge conflicts and accelerated feature delivery by 60%
responsibilities: Redesigned the entire CI/CD pipeline to support automated per-branch environment deployment with minimal configuration
Architected and implemented a self-managed AWS infrastructure leveraging CloudFront, Fargate, RDS, and other managed services
Created and maintained Infrastructure as Code templates using Terraform and AWS CDK
achievements: Reduced time from code commit to production-ready deployments from days to hours
Eliminated most of deployment-related merge conflicts through isolated environment architecture
Implemented sophisticated A/B testing infrastructure at CDN level, allowing for data-driven UX decisions
Obtained AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner certification

volunteer.summary: Helped organize coding workshops and mentored new members.

certificates.name: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
certificates.issuer: Amazon Web Services Training and Certification

highlights: Built with VanillaJS, no Backend required
